section.title: Flood Concepts
section.para: This section needs to take the probability concepts introduced in the introduction and present them as the foundation of the probability of floods. Included in this discussion needs to be the assumptions implicitly and explicitly adopted to enable the approach. Also, the discussion of flood probability needs to be independent of hydrograph characteristic; in other words it needs to be applicable to any hydrograph characteristic. Nonetheless, it needs to highlight why flows are used predominately, i.e. the continuous flood probability model whereas level has a discontinuous flood probability model.
